com.github.jukkakarvanen.kafka.streams.test

Class TestOutputTopic<K,V>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.jukkakarvanen.kafka.streams.test.TestOutputTopic<K,V>
  • Type Parameters:
    K - the type of the Kafka key
    V - the type of the Kafka value

    public class TestOutputTopic<K,V>
extends Object
    TestOutputTopic is used to read records from topic in TopologyTestDriver. This class makes it easier to write tests with TopologyTestDriver. To use TestOutputTopic create new class with topicName and correct Serdes or Deserializers In actual test code, you can read message values, keys, KeyValue or ProducerRecord without needing to pass serdes each time You need to have own TestOutputTopic for each topic.

    If you need to test key, value and headers, use readRecord() methods. Using readKeyValue() you get directly KeyValue, but have no access to headers any more Using readValue() you get directly value, but have no access to key or headers any more

    Processing messages

    
     private TestOutputTopic<String, Long> outputTopic;
      ...
     outputTopic = new TestOutputTopic<>(testDriver, outputTopic, new Serdes.StringSerde(), new Serdes.LongSerde());
     ...
     assertThat(outputTopic.readValue()).isEqual(1);
    Author:
    Jukka Karvanen / jukinimi.com
    See Also:
    TopologyTestDriver, ConsumerRecordFactory
